intro: Stegnogramma, commonly known as the silverleaf stegnogramma, is a member of the family Acanthaceae. It is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray leaves, which are covered in fine, pubescent hairs. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Stegnogramma is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit.
